semantic_title: Coding Guidelines for Secondary Malignant Neoplasm of Lymphoid Tissue with Extranodal Metastasis
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 2. Chapter 2: Neoplasms > t. Secondary malignant neoplasm of lymphoid tissue

content.full_text: When a malignant neoplasm of lymphoid tissue metastasizes beyond the lymph nodes, a code from categories C81-C85 with a final character identifying 'extranodal and solid organ sites' should be assigned rather than a code for the secondary neoplasm of the affected solid organ. For example, for metastasis of diffuse large B-cell lymphoma to the lung, brain and left adrenal gland, assign code C83.398, Diffuse large B-cell lymphoma of other extranodal and solid organ sites. (Evidence: pg no: 39, L10-L13)
content.summary: Guidelines for coding lymphoid tissue malignancies that metastasize to extranodal sites using specific extranodal codes rather than secondary neoplasm codes (Evidence: pg no: 39, L10-L13)
key_concepts: Lymphoid malignancies metastasizing beyond lymph nodes (Evidence: pg no: 39, L10-L11)
Use extranodal and solid organ site codes from C81-C85 (Evidence: pg no: 39, L11-L12)
Do not use secondary neoplasm codes for affected organs (Evidence: pg no: 39, L11-L12)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Use C81-C85 codes with extranodal final character for lymphoid metastasis (Evidence: pg no: 39, L11-L12)
detailed_rules.explanation: When malignant lymphoid tissue spreads beyond lymph nodes to solid organs, use the appropriate code from categories C81-C85 with the final character that identifies extranodal and solid organ sites (Evidence: pg no: 39, L11-L12)
common_applications: Lymphoma metastasis to other solid organs

detailed_rules.rule_text: Do not assign secondary neoplasm codes for affected solid organs (Evidence: pg no: 39, L11-L12)
detailed_rules.explanation: Instead of coding the metastatic involvement as secondary neoplasm of the specific organ, use the lymphoma code that specifies extranodal involvement (Evidence: pg no: 39, L11-L12)
common_applications: Avoiding C77-C79 codes for lymphoma metastasis

workflow_steps: Step 1: Identify malignant lymphoid tissue neoplasm
Step 2: Determine if metastasis extends beyond lymph nodes
Step 4: Assign appropriate C81-C85 code with extranodal final character
Step 5: Do not assign secondary neoplasm codes

code_ranges.description: Malignant neoplasms of lymphoid, hematopoietic and related tissue (Evidence: pg no: 39, L11)
code_ranges.requirement: Use final character for extranodal and solid organ sites
usage_rules: Select code based on specific lymphoma type (Evidence: pg no: 39, L11-L12)
Use extranodal final character when metastasized beyond lymph nodes (Evidence: pg no: 39, L11-L12)

specific_codes.description: Diffuse large B-cell lymphoma of other extranodal and solid organ sites (Evidence: pg no: 39, L12-L13)
specific_codes.context: Example for diffuse large B-cell lymphoma metastasized to lung, brain, and adrenal gland

breakdown.98: Other extranodal and solid organ sites

code_patterns.description: Pattern for extranodal and solid organ sites in lymphoma codes (Evidence: pg no: 39, L12-L13)
code_patterns.explanation: Final characters 98 typically indicate other extranodal and solid organ sites

code_categories_mentioned: Secondary neoplasm codes (excluded for this scenario)

coding_scenarios.scenario: Diffuse large B-cell lymphoma with metastasis to lung, brain, and left adrenal gland
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Patient with diffuse large B-cell lymphoma metastatic to lung, brain, and left adrenal gland
step_by_step: Step 1: Identify diffuse large B-cell lymphoma
Step 2: Note metastasis to multiple solid organs
Step 3: Determine this is extranodal involvement
Step 4: Assign C83.398 for extranodal sites
Step 5: Do not assign secondary neoplasm codes

correct_coding.rationale: Single code captures lymphoma type and extranodal involvement (Evidence: pg no: 39, L12-L13)

incorrect_coding.rationale: Should not use secondary neoplasm codes for lymphoma metastasis
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Coding each metastatic site separately as secondary neoplasm

examples.scenario: Diffuse large B-cell lymphoma with extranodal metastasis

breakdown.C83: Non-follicular lymphoma category (Evidence: pg no: 39, L12)
breakdown.3: Diffuse large B-cell lymphoma subtype (Evidence: pg no: 39, L12)
breakdown.98: Other extranodal and solid organ sites (Evidence: pg no: 39, L12-L13)

examples.rationale: Single code captures both lymphoma type and extranodal involvement (Evidence: pg no: 39, L12-L13)

warnings: Do not use secondary neoplasm codes for lymphoma metastasis to solid organs (Evidence: pg no: 39, L11-L12)
best_practices: Use extranodal codes from C81-C85 for lymphoma metastasis (Evidence: pg no: 39, L11-L12)
Single code captures both primary lymphoma and metastatic involvement (Evidence: pg no: 39, L12-L13)
common_mistakes: Coding each metastatic site as separate secondary neoplasm (Evidence: pg no: 39, L11-L12)
tips: Look for final characters indicating extranodal and solid organ sites (Evidence: pg no: 39, L11-L12)
implementation_notes: Requires identification of specific lymphoma type
Must distinguish between nodal and extranodal involvement
clinical_context: Applies when lymphoma spreads beyond lymph nodes
